oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spencer Rifle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Model 1860 Spencer Rifle associated with Sgt. William Y. Larkin[s] Co. A, 12th Tenn. Cav. Battn., CSA of Carter's Valley, Hawkins County, Tenn. Larkin enlisted on Feb. 9, 1863 at Lyon's Store. He was captured or deserted April 24, 1865 and took the oath of allegiance five days later. The Spencer rifle was a Union weapon and technologically advanced. The Confederates captured some Spencer rifles and carbines, but they could not manufacture the ammunition. How Larkins ended up with a Spencer is unknown.
